data.title: RUN WITH THE HORSES MARATHON
data.meta_description:
Course Description 
The race is always the 3rd weekend in August, 2018 it is on the weekend of the 17th and 18th of August.Packet pick-up will be 4-8 pm in front of Expedition Island. The Friday night optional Cajun shrimp boil/pasta meal begins at 5:30pm. All 3 races begin at Sat. 6:30a.m. in front of Expedition Island. Elevation is 6100' at start. The first 2 miles are city streets or the paved Greenbelt Trail along the Green River. The course then turns onto The Wild Horse Loop Tour Road, a County graded dirt road. You will begin your run up 1st Springs Canyon, approx. 2 miles. At the head of the canyon the ele. will now be about 7300'. You will then be running across the top of White Mountain on the Wild Horse Loop Tour over rolling hills between 7300 and 7500'. Previous years runners described the course as challenging. This is a high plains desert, there will be no shade trees after you leave the city streets. Many runners stop and take photos of the vistas and any wild horses they encounter. This is an up and back course, at the halfway point of each respective race you will turn around and return back to Green River. There will be aid stations every 2 miles starting at mile 2. Water, Gatorade every 2 miles, fruit, chips, granola bars, M & M's, etc. will be provided at several aid stations. There will be porta potties at the race start, mile 2, mile 6.5 and at 13.1 marathon turnaround. There will be awards for the winners in several categories. Your entry fee includes a tech. t-shirt, and finisher medal. The ticket to Fri.5:30pm shrimp boil ($20) pasta meal ($10) is available when you register or directly from the Chamber.You can register at www.runnercard.com or print application and information from the chamber website.This area is a high plains desert. Temperature will probably be in the 40's at the start and low 80's by noon. The Festival includes: Beer Garden; Horse Shoe Tournament; Car & Bike Show; Duck Race; Fireworks; Dog Fetching Contest, and Humane Society Dog Show. 

In addition you will have the oppertunity to attend the Art on the Green also in conjunction Friday and Saturday.  Many vendors will be there with their Homemade-Handmade item.  Food vendors will aslo be there to sell food thoughout the weekend.  Free Addmission to all of these event. Play it Again Entertainment will be have DJ music Friday eventing and Nowhere Fast will be in concert on Saturday night. 

The race ends in front of Expedition Island which is located in the middle of the Green River. This is where Maj. John Wesley Powell started his exploration of the Colorado River in the late 1800's. This is a great mountain biking area.
data.text:
Course Description

The race is always the 3rd weekend in August. The race is held in conjunction with the annual River Festival which kicks off that Friday with a cajun shrimp boil, homemade/handmade craft vendors, beer gardens, a band, food trucks and FIREWORKS! The marathon will be held on Saturday, August 16th, 2025. Packet/bib pick-up will be 4-7 pm at The Expedition Island (475 South 2nd East) on August 16th, be prepared to sign a waiver of release for the Green River Chamber of Commerce on the day of packet pick-up.

All 3 races begin Saturday @ 7:00 a.m. in front of the pavilion at The Expedition Island. Elevation is 6100' at start. The first 2 miles are city streets and the paved Greenbelt Trail along the Green River. The course then turns onto The Wild Horse Loop Tour Road, a County graded dirt road. You will begin your run up 1st Springs Canyon, approx. 2 miles. At the head of the canyon the elevation will now be about 7300'. You will then be running across the top of White Mountain on the Wild Horse Loop Tour over rolling hills between 7300 and 7500'. Previous runners described the course as challenging and rewarding.

This is a high plains desert, there will be no shade trees after you leave the city streets. Many runners stop and take photos of the vistas and any wild horses and other wildlife they encounter. This is an up and back course, at the halfway point of each respective race you will turn around and return back to Green River to the Expedition Island.

There will be aid stations every 2 miles starting at mile 2. Water, Gatorade every 2 miles. There will be port-a-potties at the race start, mile 2, mile 6.5 and at 13.1 marathon turnaround. With a 7 hour time limit for all levels, this is a unique race! There will be awards for the winners in several categories.

Your entry fee includes a t-shirt and a very unique finisher medal. 10K runners if interested will need to purchase their t-shirts for and extra $20.00 each. Full and half runners - your shirts will be included in your race fee.

Need a place to stay?

We have plenty of places to stay in Green River Wyoming. Go to our website now to find the right place for you! https://www.grchamber.com/

Flying?

Rock Springs Sweetwater County Airport

PO Box 1987 Rock Springs, WY 82902 (307) 352-6880 fly@sweetwater.net

The Rock Springs Sweetwater County Airport is located 7 miles East of Rock Springs. To get to the airport, take I-80 East out of Rock Springs. Take exit 111 and go South on highway 370. The airport is about 3.5 miles down the road on top of the mesa.

Rock Springs Airport Terminal 307-362-0416

Enterprise Rent-A-Car 800-736-8222

Hertz Rent a Car 307-382-3262

Thrifty Car Rental 866-344-7420

Sweetwater County is 2.5 hours from Salt Lake International Airport and approximately 5 hours from Denver International Airport.

On August 16th packet pick up will begin at 4 PM. Please make sure to come pick up your packet at this time, as we also have a physical waiver that you will have to sign! We look forward to having you this year at our Annual Run with the Horses Marathon/Half/10K.

Alliance Physical Therapy will be at the finish line of the Run with the Horses Marathon/Half/10K offering FREE

services to the runners. They are offering dry needling, taping, massage/soft

tissue work, and other minor injury treatment.
